column4: Anyone know how to get the gcc math libraries working on a new installation of 12.04?
I can't even get sqrt to work.
gcc test.c -lm; thought might help to give a bit more details
I can paste a line...
/tmp/ccGgpkmz.o: In function `dEdX':
elast.c:(.text+0x17ec): undefined reference to `sqrt'
yes I figured the output, the line you used to compile would be more useful, though as long as you specify -lm at the end you should be okay
In 10.04, it found the math libraries.  With the same gcc ... -lm... I get those errors.
position matters
it has to come after the source files that reference it
I'm doing gcc -lm -o elast elast.c
I should move -lm to the end?
yes that is incorrect
yes, gcc -o elast elast.c -lm
Huh!  Never complained on any other linux.
Got lucky, I guess.
it used to work before 11.10, but mostly by accident, the linker would once link implicitly with all libraries passed it, now it only links if the symbols are referenced
and it searched for symbols left to right on the commandline
Su'm'gun.  Thanks, trism.
Funny--the guy who made up this install script is a good programmer, so I was sure it was my new 12.04.
Thanks for the help, friends, before I started ripping my computer apart.
it isn't really surprising, many many projects had to be fixed (and we are still finding broken ones)
Well, thanks!  Anything I can help YOU with?  :)
no I'm alright, thanks though
